content:
Margins Class

In this Article

Specifies the dimensions of the margins of a printed page.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Drawing.Printing.MarginsConverter))]
public class Margins : ICloneable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • Margins

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

The Margins class is used to manipulate the width of margins in PageSettings and PrintController. MarginsConverter is the type descriptor for this class.

Left, Right, Top, and Bottom are properties that define the margins. Clone creates an identical Margins. Equals determines if another object has the same dimensions as a Margins.

For more information about printing, see the System.Drawing.Printing namespace overview.

Constructors summary

Margins()

Initializes a new instance of the Margins class with 1-inch wide margins.
Margins(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the Margins class with the specified left, right, top, and bottom margins.

Properties summary

Bottom

Gets or sets the bottom margin, in hundredths of an inch.
Left

Gets or sets the left margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
Right

Gets or sets the right margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
Top

Gets or sets the top margin width, in hundredths of an inch.

Methods summary

Clone()

Retrieves a duplicate of this object, member by member.
Equals(Object)

Compares this Margins to the specified Object to determine whether they have the same dimensions.
GetHashCode()

Calculates and retrieves a hash code based on the width of the left, right, top, and bottom margins.
ToString()

Converts the Margins to a string.

Operators summary

op_Equality(Margins,Margins)

Compares two Margins to determine if they have the same dimensions.
op_Inequality(Margins,Margins)

Compares two Margins to determine whether they are of unequal width.

Constructors

  • Margins()

    Initializes a new instance of the Margins class with 1-inch wide margins.

    public Margins ();
  • Margins(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32)

    Initializes a new instance of the Margins class with the specified left, right, top, and bottom margins.

    public Margins (int left, int right, int top, int bottom);

    Parameters

    • left
      Int32

      The left margin, in hundredths of an inch.

    • right
      Int32

      The right margin, in hundredths of an inch.

    • top
      Int32

      The top margin, in hundredths of an inch.

    • bottom
      Int32

      The bottom margin, in hundredths of an inch.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The left parameter value is less than 0.

      -or-

      The right parameter value is less than 0.

      -or-

      The top parameter value is less than 0.

      -or-

      The bottom parameter value is less than 0.

    Example

    Use the System.Drawing, System.Drawing.Printing, and System.IO namespaces for this example.

    The following code example sets the default page settings for a document to margins of 1 inch width on each side. 

     public void Printing()
 {
   try 
   {
     /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named filePath,
        has been set to the path of the file to print. */
     streamToPrint = new StreamReader (filePath);
     try 
     {
       printFont = new Font("Arial", 10);
       PrintDocument pd = new PrintDocument(); 
       /* This assumes that a method, named pd_PrintPage, has been
          defined. pd_PrintPage handles the PrintPage event. */
       pd.PrintPage += new PrintPageEventHandler(pd_PrintPage);
       /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named 
          printer, has been set to the printer's name. */
       pd.PrinterSettings.PrinterName = printer;
       // Create a new instance of Margins with one inch margins.
       Margins margins = new Margins(100,100,100,100);
       pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins = margins;
       pd.Print();
     } 
     finally 
     {
       streamToPrint.Close() ;
     }
   } 
   catch(Exception ex) 
   { 
     MessageBox.Show("An error occurred printing the file - " + ex.Message);
   }
 }
 

     Public Sub Printing()
     Try
         ' This assumes that a variable of type string, named filePath,
         ' has been set to the path of the file to print. 
         streamToPrint = New StreamReader(filePath)
         Try
             printFont = New Font("Arial", 10)
             Dim pd As New PrintDocument()
             ' This assumes that a method, named pd_PrintPage, has been
             ' defined. pd_PrintPage handles the PrintPage event. 
             AddHandler pd.PrintPage, AddressOf pd_PrintPage
             ' This assumes that a variable of type string, named
             ' printer, has been set to the printer's name. 
             pd.PrinterSettings.PrinterName = printer
             ' Create a new instance of Margins with one inch margins.
             Dim margins As New Margins(100, 100, 100, 100)
             pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins = margins
             pd.Print()
         Finally
             streamToPrint.Close()
         End Try
     Catch ex As Exception
         MessageBox.Show("An error occurred printing the file - " & ex.Message)
     End Try
 End Sub
    

       void Printing()
   {
      try
      {
         
         /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named filePath,
                 has been set to the path of the file to print. */
         streamToPrint = gcnew StreamReader( filePath );
         try
         {
            printFont = gcnew System::Drawing::Font( "Arial",10 );
            PrintDocument^ pd = gcnew PrintDocument;
            
            /* This assumes that a method, named pd_PrintPage, has been
                      defined. pd_PrintPage handles the PrintPage event. */
            pd->PrintPage += gcnew PrintPageEventHandler( this, &Sample::pd_PrintPage );
            
            /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named 
                      printer, has been set to the printer's name. */
            pd->PrinterSettings->PrinterName = printer;
            
            // Create a new instance of Margins with one inch margins.
            Margins^ margins = gcnew Margins( 100,100,100,100 );
            pd->DefaultPageSettings->Margins = margins;
            pd->Print();
         }
         finally
         {
            streamToPrint->Close();
         }

      }
      catch ( Exception^ ex ) 
      {
         MessageBox::Show( String::Concat( "An error occurred printing the file - ", ex->Message ) );
      }

   }

Properties

  • Bottom

    Gets or sets the bottom margin, in hundredths of an inch.

    public int Bottom { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The bottom margin, in hundredths of an inch.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The Bottom property is set to a value that is less than 0.

    Remarks

    If you measure margins in millimeters, multiply the margin width you want in millimeters by 3.937 to determine the correct measurement in hundredths of an inch. For example, if you want a margin of 25mm, multiply by 3.937 and the result is 98 when rounded down. You would then set the appropriate Margins member to 98.

    Example

    Use the System.Drawing, System.Drawing.Printing, and System.IO namespaces for this example.

    The following code example sets the default page settings for a document to left and right margins of 1 inch in width, and top and bottom margins of 1.5 inches in width. 

       void Printing()
   {
      try
      {
         
         /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named filePath,
                 has been set to the path of the file to print. */
         streamToPrint = gcnew StreamReader( filePath );
         try
         {
            printFont = gcnew System::Drawing::Font( "Arial",10 );
            PrintDocument^ pd = gcnew PrintDocument;
            
            /* This assumes that a method, named pd_PrintPage, has been
                      defined. pd_PrintPage handles the PrintPage event. */
            pd->PrintPage += gcnew PrintPageEventHandler( this, &Sample::pd_PrintPage );
            
            /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named 
                      printer, has been set to the printer's name. */
            pd->PrinterSettings->PrinterName = printer;
            
            // Set the left and right margins to 1 inch.
            pd->DefaultPageSettings->Margins->Left = 100;
            pd->DefaultPageSettings->Margins->Right = 100;
            
            // Set the top and bottom margins to 1.5 inches.
            pd->DefaultPageSettings->Margins->Top = 150;
            pd->DefaultPageSettings->Margins->Bottom = 150;
            pd->Print();
         }
         finally
         {
            streamToPrint->Close();
         }

      }
      catch ( Exception^ ex ) 
      {
         MessageBox::Show( String::Concat( "An error occurred printing the file - ", ex->Message ) );
      }

   }

         streamToPrint = New StreamReader(filePath)
         Try

             Dim pd As New PrintDocument()
             ' This assumes that a method, named pd_PrintPage, has been
             ' defined. pd_PrintPage handles the PrintPage event. 
             AddHandler pd.PrintPage, AddressOf pd_PrintPage
             ' This assumes that a variable of type string, named
             ' printer, has been set to the printer's name. 
             pd.PrinterSettings.PrinterName = printer
                
             ' Set the left and right margins to 1 inch.
             pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Left = 100
             pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Right = 100
             ' Set the top and bottom margins to 1.5 inches.
             pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Top = 150
             pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Bottom = 150
                
             pd.Print()
         Finally
             streamToPrint.Close()
         End Try
     Catch ex As Exception
         MessageBox.Show("An error occurred printing the file - " & ex.Message)
     End Try
 End Sub

 {
   try 
   {
     /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named filePath,
        has been set to the path of the file to print. */
     streamToPrint = new StreamReader (filePath);
     try 
     {
       printFont = new Font("Arial", 10);
       PrintDocument pd = new PrintDocument(); 
       /* This assumes that a method, named pd_PrintPage, has been
          defined. pd_PrintPage handles the PrintPage event. */
       pd.PrintPage += new PrintPageEventHandler(pd_PrintPage);
       /* This assumes that a variable of type string, named 
          printer, has been set to the printer's name. */
       pd.PrinterSettings.PrinterName = printer;
 
       // Set the left and right margins to 1 inch.
       pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Left = 100;
       pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Right = 100;
       // Set the top and bottom margins to 1.5 inches.
       pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Top = 150;
       pd.DefaultPageSettings.Margins.Bottom = 150;
 
       pd.Print();
     } 
     finally 
     {
       streamToPrint.Close() ;
     }
   } 
   catch(Exception ex) 
   { 
     MessageBox.Show("An error occurred printing the file - " + ex.Message);
   }
 }

Methods

  • Clone()

    Retrieves a duplicate of this object, member by member.

    public object Clone ();

    Returns

    • System.Object

      A duplicate of this object.

  • Equals(Object)

    Compares this Margins to the specified Object to determine whether they have the same dimensions.

    public override bool Equals (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      System.Object

      The object to which to compare this Margins.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified object is a Margins and has the same stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Top*, stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Bottom*, stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Right* and stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Left* values as this Margins; otherwise, false.

  • GetHashCode()

    Calculates and retrieves a hash code based on the width of the left, right, top, and bottom margins.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A hash code based on the left, right, top, and bottom margins.

  • ToString()

    Converts the Margins to a string.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String representation of the Margins.

Operators

  • op_Equality(Margins,Margins)

    Compares two Margins to determine if they have the same dimensions.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Drawing.Printing.Margins m1, System.Drawing.Printing.Margins m2);

    Parameters

    • m1
      Margins

      The first Margins to compare for equality.

    • m2
      Margins

      The second Margins to compare for equality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true to indicate the stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Left*, stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Right*, stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Top*, and stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Bottom* properties of both margins have the same value; otherwise, false.

  • op_Inequality(Margins,Margins)

    Compares two Margins to determine whether they are of unequal width.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Drawing.Printing.Margins m1, System.Drawing.Printing.Margins m2);

    Parameters

    • m1
      Margins

      The first Margins to compare for inequality.

    • m2
      Margins

      The second Margins to compare for inequality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true to indicate if the stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Left*, stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Right*, stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Top*, or stem.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Bottom* properties of both margins are not equal; otherwise, false.
